intro: Myriadenus glutinosus, commonly known as the sticky myriadenus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance, which is a notable botanical feature. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The sticky secretions may play a role in deterring herbivores or aiding in pollination.
